title: Red Rooster delivery driver is robbed at knifepoint in Brisbane street
text:
A gang of machete-wielding thugs robbed a teenage girl at knife-point before running off with a bag of chicken.

The 17-year-old was making a delivery for Red Rooster, in Durack, south-west Brisbane, at 8.15pm on Sunday when she was mugged.

She was making a delivery to Glengallan Place when a man approached the car she was driving.

The teenager was making a delivery for Red Rooster in Durack, south-west Brisbane, at 8.15pm on Sunday when she was mugged (stock)

When she went to give the man food two other men approached her.

One of the men drew machetes and a screwdriver and the group demanded the 17-year-old had over the money she had.

She told them she had no money with her.

They took the food she was supposed to deliver and headed in the direction of Blunder Road.

The teenager was not physically harmed during the hold up.

Police described the men as being in their late teens with a slim build.

Anyone with information or CCTV footage is asked to contact Policelink on 131 444.
description: The teenager was making a delivery for Red Rooster, in Durack, south-west Brisbane, at 8.15pm on Sunday when she was mugged.
authors: Claudia Poposki For Daily Mail Australia
